labels.analysis: The MCP Server for Monday.com enables interaction with Monday.com's project management boards and items. Its core functionality revolves around creating, retrieving, and managing items, updates, and sub-items within the platform. The server provides tools for listing boards, groups, items, and sub-items, as well as creating new items or updates. This aligns with task management and project organization use cases, primarily serving as a bridge between external systems and Monday.com's API.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Project Management" was chosen because the server's tools are centered around managing tasks, items, and boards within a project management system (Monday.com). Secondary labels "API Integration" and "Database Operations" were selected because the server essentially acts as an API wrapper for Monday.com's functionalities, allowing structured data operations (CRUD) against boards and items. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's purpose.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@sakce/mcp-server-monday/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: mondayApiKey
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: The API key for the Monday.com API.
